title: Restore missing main navigation menu after Version 15 deployment

requirements.summary: Restore the main navigation menu in App.tsx that displays all menu items (Dashboard, Add Voter, Voter List, Label Printing, Task Management, Analytics) for both mobile and desktop views
acceptanceCriteria: Main navigation menu is visible on both mobile and desktop views
Menu displays all items: Dashboard, Add Voter, Voter List, Label Printing, Task Management, and Analytics
Navigation menu appears below or alongside the header with 'Voter Management System' title
Logout button remains visible and functional
Navigation links route correctly to their respective pages

file_operations.description: Restore the navigation menu JSX elements that render the six menu items (Dashboard, Add Voter, Voter List, Label Printing, Task Management, Analytics) with proper routing links. Ensure the navigation is positioned correctly within the authenticated layout below or alongside the header. Verify that no conditional rendering logic is preventing the menu from displaying when the user is authenticated. The navigation should be visible on both mobile (hamburger menu or vertical list) and desktop (horizontal menu bar) views.

requirements.summary: Verify and fix any CSS classes, conditional rendering, or display properties that may be hiding the navigation menu
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation menu JSX elements are present in the App.tsx component
No CSS classes with display:none or visibility:hidden are applied to navigation elements
Conditional rendering logic does not prevent menu from displaying when user is authenticated
Navigation menu is not positioned off-screen or with zero height/width

file_operations.description: Review and remove any CSS classes or inline styles that apply display:none, visibility:hidden, opacity:0, or off-screen positioning to the navigation menu elements. Check all conditional rendering logic (e.g., isAuthenticated checks, role-based conditions) to ensure they do not inadvertently hide the menu when a user is logged in. Verify that the navigation container has appropriate height, width, and display properties. If the menu uses responsive classes (e.g., hidden on mobile), ensure proper breakpoint classes are applied for both mobile and desktop visibility.

Review global CSS styles to ensure no rules are inadvertently hiding navigation elements. Check for any styles targeting navigation, nav, menu, or header elements that might apply display:none, visibility:hidden, or z-index issues. Remove or adjust any conflicting styles that prevent the navigation menu from being visible.
